channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Teen makes history with Dipsea victory
item.description: Tiburon’s Audrey MacLean, 19, is first female runner between 10 and 33 to win the nation’s oldest trail race.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere tackling fixes for police staff shortage
item.description: The sixth position has been deferred since 2020 due to budget constraints and one officer on medical leave.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Belvedere gives final nod to $14.22M budget
item.description: The projected expenditures against $11.38 million in revenue result in a $2.84 million deficit that will be covered by withdrawals from the city’s general and critical-infrastructure funds.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Reed district projects $1.8-mil deficit on $33.2-mil budget
item.description: Several factors are driving the projected deficit, including rising special-education costs, increased personnel costs and a funding gap for foundation-sponsored programs.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Local agency overseeing school-bus program approves $976,000 budget
item.description: The joint-powers agency that oversees school-bus service is projecting a $178,000 surplus in its fiscal 2025-2026 budget.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: New Business: Istanbul natives bring Troya Mediterranean restaurant to Cove
item.description: In May, the Kinalilars opened Troya restaurant in The Cove shopping center, serving Turkish and Mediterranean fare.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A Tiburon man’s youth included driving a queen and hijinks on the river
item.description: Burkett, who turned 93 on June 15, served in the U.S. Navy during the Korean War, achieving the rank of commander.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere: State poised to accept latest housing plan
item.description: City officials say HCD "has indicated its informal approval of the proposed revisions" to the 188-unit 2023-2031 housing element.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Hessel
